description: This 18th-century folding screen, part of a pair, is by one of the best known painters in Japan, Soga Shōhaku, revered for his unusual subjects and eccentric style. This screen focuses on the iconic Mount Fuji, a sacred site since ancient times. Shо̄haku depicted the mountain completely covered in snow, painting it in negative. The white of the mountain is the color of the bare paper, and the outlines of the peak are done with ink wash.
artist_info:
Soga Shōhaku 曾我 蕭白
Japanese
1730-1781
title: Mount Fuji and the Miho Pine Forest
